qas.question: How do archaeologists know about Sumerian agricultural practices?
When would farmers flood their fields?

answers.text: after the Spring Equinox and the Akitu

qas.question: Why did the Sumerian farmers make their oxen stomp the ground?
How many times did Sumerian farmers plow, harrow and rake the ground?
The the Ur III period, what crop had Sumerians switched to from wheat for their primary crop?
What people first wrote an Almanac?
What was the name of the first Almanac?
What did farmers flood just before the new year?
When did farmers switch from barley to wheat?

context: As is known <a0_0>from the <b6_0>"<b5_0>Sumerian<b5_0/> Farmer's Almanac"<a0_0/>,<b6_0/> after the flood season and <a1_0>after the Spring Equinox and the Akitu<a1_0/> or New Year Festival, using the canals, farmers would flood <b7_0>their fields<b7_0/> and then drain the water. Next they made oxen stomp the ground and <a2_0>kill weeds<a2_0/>. They then dragged the fields with pickaxes. After drying, they plowed, harrowed, and raked the ground <a3_0>three times<a3_0/>, and pulverized it with a mattock, before planting seed. Unfortunately the high evaporation rate resulted in a gradual increase in the salinity of the fields. <b8_0>By the Ur III period<b8_0/>, farmers had switched from wheat to the more <a4_0>salt-tolerant barley<a4_0/> as their principal crop.
